page.title: 14The Hand and Cleaver
page.content: The Hand and Cleaver was built in the late sixteenth century and started as a farm. The owners brewer beer and it became known as the local ale-house. It is now a very popular public house with a very good local reputation as a restaurant. The owner, Mr Slater, employs twenty-four staff, two of whom are chefs. The regular customers come from about a ten mile radius while restaurant customers come from further afield. The name of the pub stems from the time when the place was a farm. One of the owners used to slaughter his cattle with a cleaver.
